srm_reg

Template class to represent a register.

A register represents a set of fields that are accessible as a single entity.  The template parameter must be packed structure representing the fields of the register.

Summary
srm_reg
Template class to represent a register.
Class Hierarchy
srm_component
srm_base_reg
srm_reg

Initialization

new

function new( string  name,
srm_component  parent )

Create a new instance of a register.

parent represents the component in the tree hierarchy.

Converter

data_2_bytes

virtual function srm_data_t data_2_bytes( const ref  T  data )

Converts the tempate data type into a list of bytes.

{byte_n, byte_n_1,......, byte_1, byte_0} = [msb....lsb] Template data type must be byte aligned.

bytes_2_data

virtual function T bytes_2_data( const ref  srm_data_t  bytes )

Converts a list of bytes into the template data type.

[msb.....lsb] = {byte_n_1,......, byte_1, byte_0}

Access Model Only

get

virtual function T get()

Return the template data of the register.

Gets all the data from the constituent fields and packs them into the template type.

set

virtual function void set( T  data )

Set the value of the data in the model.

Could do ‘const ref’ but that prevents passing a literal constant.

Access Model+Design

read

virtual task read( srm_base_handle  handle,
ref  T  data )

Read the data from the design and compare against all non volatile model values.

handle has all the option setting for the read.  data is the data returned from the design.

Task will call uvm_error if the field is not volatile and the model value does not match the value read from the design.

write

virtual task write( srm_base_handle  handle,
T  data )

Write the data to the design and model.

handle has all the option setting for the write.  data is the data to be written to the design and model.

It is possible to make data as const ref but then I cannot pass literal constants.

A node in the design tree hierarchy.
